issue.title: [CF 761] Implementing IconModule_GroupMover (or a derivative) requies that GroupModule_GroupPosition be already implemented.
issue.body:
Occurred when copying the setting of another profile.

Message: ...ponents\IconModules\IconModule_GroupMover\module.lua line 57:
   Implementing IconModule_GroupMover (or a derivative) requies that GroupModule_GroupPosition (or a derivative) be already implemented.

> Posted by CurseForge user AmeroGer | Imported from CurseForge issue #761 | Raw

comments.body:
I've seen it a few times, but I still haven't been able to figure out why the modules are being implemented in the wrong order...

This stack trace shows that the icon that is triggering the error is being setup from within its group's setup method, which means that isn't an error with things being called externally in the wrong order. So, it has to be something wrong with the group internals that isn't implementing GroupModule_GroupPosition when it should be....

Unfortunately, it is much harder to debug why something isn't happening than it is to debug why something is happening. Fortunately, this shouldn't be a super major issue since a simple lock toggle should 'fix' it. I have exams coming up, plus I'm moving this weekend, so it could be a week or two before I get around to figuring this out.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

I still have no idea why this is happening. It is a rare enough occurrence, though, and it isn't going to break anything badly, that I'm not going to worry about it.

This may be the first time I ever declined a defect ticket. Oh well.

Edited Apr 12, 2013

> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras
